student

Class EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt

  • java.lang.Object
    • student.EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EscapeStrategy

    public class EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt
extends java.lang.Object
implements EscapeStrategy
    Author:
    YasserAlejandro A class that provides an implementation of an EscapeStrategy. It is informed in the sense that it has four data structures (Maps) to gather as much information as possible about all the nodes in the cavern and leverage this information in the navigation process. It is GoldSeek oriented in the sense that it looks for as much gold as possible until it knows that it needs to head to the Exit node to avoid being trapped in the cavern. It is ExitOptimizer in the sense that once it knows that it needs to head to the Exit node, it uses the minimal path strategy to reach that Exit node.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceToNode

        public int getDistanceToNode(game.Node node2)
        This method returns a distance between the state's current node and a particular Node. If the node is a neighbor it returns the length of the edge between them. If the node is not a neighbor it returns an infinitive value (Integer.MAX_VALUE). The latter is the express that the node is not directly connected to the current state node.
        Parameters:
        node - whose distance we want to estimate from the state's current node.
        Returns:
        the distance between the state's current node and the node specified in the param.

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.Collection<game.Node> getNeighbors(game.Node node)
        This method is used to gather and provide all the navigable neighbors of any Node. Navigable means any node that is open. I could have used the getNeighbors method from the Node class and filter to Navigable ones. However, the improvement in the performance by the use of this method is significant in the gold collection process.
        Parameters:
        any - node whose neighbor's we wish to determine
        Returns:
        a Collection of Nodes with all the neighbor's of the node specified on @param.

      • populateMaps

        public void populateMaps()
        This method is to populate all the different data structures being used in this class.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        This is the actual execution of the strategy of this class. It first ensures that there is enough time to reach the exit node before moving to any new node. It compares two nodes based on their visited frequency. It favors the movement into non-visited and less visited nodes. If none of the neighbor's nodes of the current state's node is reachable (meaning, no enough time to reach it and reach the exit node), then the method evokes the Metadata of the current node to find the optimal path to the exit Node and follows that path.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface EscapeStrategy
